intro: Ifloga spicata, commonly known as the spike-flowered plant, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its clustered inflorescences, which consist of small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in spikes. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface.
